recommendations.name: Brooklyn Steel
recommendations.description: This is a super cool, standing-room-only venue with great sound!

recommendations.name: Caff√® Vita
recommendations.description: Hands down best coffee in Bushwick. Try the lavender latte or campfire latte!

recommendations.name: Evil Katsu
recommendations.description: OMG incredibly delicious katsu sandwich! Chicken katsu is my fave but they're all good! The bread is like a pillow.

recommendations.name: Clockwork Bar
recommendations.description: Divey yet iconic punk bar! Great place to meet up with friends. You will not get in trouble for adding graffiti.

recommendations.name: Poster House
recommendations.description: Cheap museum (+ free admission on Fridays!) with rotating exhibits of stunning vintage and modern posters from around the world.

recommendations.name: Madison Square Garden
recommendations.description: MSG is the 'World's Most Famous Arena' and for good reason. Besides being the home of the NY Knicks & Rangers, it is the premier venue to see world-class musicians perform. In fact, Phish has played here 81 times since 1994!

recommendations.name: Transmitter Park Mural
recommendations.description: My favorite mural in all of NYC. It lives in Transmitter Park-- a small, peaceful park with stunning views of Manhattan.

recommendations.name: Ops
recommendations.description: My favorite pizza place in all of NYC. It's a sit-down restaurant so expect to pay more than you would at a slice shop, but it will be well worth it. They also have an amazing wine program, just tell them what you like and they will bring you some options to taste!

recommendations.name: Mad Tropical
recommendations.description: Many vibes to this place-- a tropical bar in the front, a casual lounge in the middle, and a disco dancefloor in the back- complete with a DJ spinning strictly 70s and 80s vinyl (bangers only). Watch out for the passionfruit margaritas... they're delicious but dangerous!

recommendations.name: Felix Roasting Co.
recommendations.description: Out of this world coffee and stunning interiors. If you want to go big, get the hickory-smoked s'mores latte with homemade roasted marshmallow.

recommendations.name: Yemen Cafe
recommendations.description: Best meal under $20... If you've never tried Yemeni cuisine before, this is the spot to go to! Plus, there's unlimited bread, soup, and tea.

recommendations.name: Kings Theatre
recommendations.description: Gorgeous theatre right next to Prospect Park. It has been around since 1929 and every concert I've seen here has been spectacular.

recommendations.name: Fotografiska
recommendations.description: A must-see if you're a photography lover!

recommendations.name: McSorley‚Äôs Old Ale House
recommendations.description: Old school Irish pub established in 1854! It only serves two drinks: light beer and dark beer.

recommendations.name: The Hideout Chai Bar
recommendations.description: Minimalist, authentic tiny chai shop!

recommendations.name: Win Son Bakery
recommendations.description: Your new favorite brunch spot. Get the scallion pancake BEC, fan tuan (rice roll stuffed with crispy pork), and mochi donut!

recommendations.name: Smalls Jazz Club
recommendations.description: Iconic NYC basement jazz club!

recommendations.name: Whitney Museum
recommendations.description: Fascinating American contemporary art museum!

recommendations.name: The Flower Shop
recommendations.description: Lowkey, classy bar with an upstairs and downstairs bar. There's a pool table in the basement and on Wednesday nights they do an awesome trivia night down there!

recommendations.name: Variety Coffee Roasters
recommendations.description: Reliable neighborhood coffee shop! Fast, fresh, and delicious.

recommendations.name: SEY Coffee
recommendations.description: Unbelievable coffee‚Äîstrongly suggest buying any of their washed beans!

recommendations.name: KENKA
recommendations.description: Kenka is FUN. Go here with a big group of friends, order a zillion dishes to share, get the beer tower, and don't forget the cotton candy machine on the way out.

recommendations.name: Olea
recommendations.description: BRUUUNNCCHH here is so good, but be prepared to wait in line. Highlights include the lamb hash, Olea breakfast, and their Bloody Mary's

recommendations.name: Awash
recommendations.description: Such delicious Ethiopian food! Veggie combo is a must.

recommendations.name: Greenwood Park
recommendations.description: Massive beer garden (with cocktails!) housed in an old gas station. Tons of outdoor space & casual/fun for the warmer days.

recommendations.name: Claro
recommendations.description: One of THE BEST Mexican restaurants in the city specializing in Oaxacan cuisine.

recommendations.name: Daytime Coffee
recommendations.description: Delicious coffee, baked goods, and sammies!

recommendations.name: Tacos El Bronco
recommendations.description: Best tacos in the city. While they have a brick & mortar location‚Äîtheir truck is far superior (on 37th St & 5th Ave)

recommendations.name: Sea Witch
recommendations.description: Come here if you're in the mood to get real drunk, eat some fries, and hang with the fish. Outside space a huge plus!

recommendations.name: Fort Defiance
recommendations.description: YUM. Classic American food spot in Red Hook. Come here for the brunch and accidentally get drunk.

recommendations.name: Di An Di
recommendations.description: If you're not ordering the Pho here, you're making a mistake. Such good Vietnamese food, it'll be your new go-to spot. Don't forget to try their signature cocktails.

recommendations.name: Glasserie
recommendations.description: This is the place to take a date you want to impress AND eat well.

recommendations.name: Wilcoxson Brooklyn Ceramics
recommendations.description: Aside from selling beautiful ceramics, Wilcoxson also has regular workshops where you can learn to make your own ceramic mugs, plates, and planters!

recommendations.name: Goods for the Study
recommendations.description: If you love stationary, pens, and soft leather journals...this is your heaven.

recommendations.name: High Dive
recommendations.description: Fun, sticky, neighborhood bar with tons of board games and endless amounts of popcorn.

recommendations.name: Evil Twin Brewery
recommendations.description: Evil Twin Brewery has two spots‚ÄîRidgewood being a personal fav. While the beer is good, their seasonal hard seltzer is where it's at.

recommendations.name: Freddy's Bar
recommendations.description: Freddy's is a bar in the front and a venue in the back. Definitely a spot to get drunk, have a bite, and stumble into a show.

recommendations.name: Pig Beach
recommendations.description: Some of the best BBQ in Brooklyn. Massive outdoor space, this is a great spot to party in the summer time and gnaw on some meat.

recommendations.name: Fragment Gallery
recommendations.description: Exciting contemporary gallery specializing in emerging artists

recommendations.name: The Invisible Dog
recommendations.description: The Invisible Dog offers TONS‚Äîimmersive art shows, venue space, performances, and shopping pop-ups.

recommendations.name: Cammareri Bros Bakery
recommendations.description: Perfect. 10/10

recommendations.name: Warsaw
recommendations.description: Super sick music venue, where you can catch a punk show & eat some delicious pierogies

recommendations.name: Frankel's Delicatessen
recommendations.description: yummy! my favorite bagels
